article.headline: Mercer 94, Fort Valley State 77
article.story: MACON, Ga. (AP) -- Scott Emerson scored 24 points and pulled down 10 rebounds to lead Mercer to a 94-77 victory over Fort Valley State Tuesday night. Wesley Duke added a season-high 17 points to go along with 11 rebounds. It was also a season high in points for the Bears (4-5). Emerson hit 9-of-14 from the floor and was 6-of-7 from the free throw line in just 24 minutes of action. He also pulled down eight of his 10 rebounds on the defensive end. Jay January added 12 points and three assists for Mercer, which closed the first half on a 14-2 run to take a 53-42 lead into the intermission. The Wildcats (2-2) got as close as three midway through the second half, before Mercer closed the game with a 24-10 run. Fort Valley had five players score in double figures, led by Brinceson Sanders' 17 points. Alan Early added 13 points and a game-high 13 rebounds.
